intro: Prainea limpato subsp. limpato, commonly known as the limping prainea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four to five petals, and it produces small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
